com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Panel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Frame
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Panel
public class Panel
extends Frame

This defines the display surface for high level API. The panel class is the frame class used in high level API and becomes a parent object for attaching components to.
When a component cannot fit in a screen, the user shall scroll using the keys.
The title can be displayed on the panel by calling the setTitle method. The title is displayed at the top of the panel. Also, the title shall be displayed in a manner that it can be clearly differentiated from other parts (highlighted, underlined or such). When a panel has a title, the title will not disappear even while scrolling, as the title will not' scroll. 

  ------+------------------+-----
    |   |  Title           | Title Area
    |   +------------------+-----
  panel |                  |   | 
    |   |                  |   |
    |   |                  |scrollable Area
    |   |                  |   |
    |   |                  |   |
    |   |                  |   |
  ------+------------------+-----
When null is designated as a parameter of setLayoutManager, the user shall use keys to scroll if the component cannot fit in the screen.

See Also:
Canvas, Dialog, FocusManager, LayoutManager, ComponentListener, SoftKeyListener, KeyListener, EventListener

Constructor Detail

Panel

public Panel()
This creates an empty panel.

Method Detail

setTitle

public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
This sets the character string of the frame title.
In default, character strings are not displayed.

Parameters:
title - Designates the title character. When "null" is designated, the display area of the title character string is deleted. When an empty character string (" ") is designated, the display area of the title character string appears but nothing is shown for the character string.

setBackground

public void setBackground(int color)
This sets the background color. The background color is changed right after this method is called. In default, the implementation dependent color is set.

Overrides:
setBackground in class Frame
Parameters:
color - Designates an integer that indicates the background color.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated argument c.
See Also:
Graphics.clearRect(int, int, int, int)

add

public void add(Component comp)
This adds components to the panel.

Throws:
UIException - Generated when trying to add more than the number of component the UE supports (NO_RESOURCES).
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for argument c.
UIException - Generated when trying to add a component that has already been added to another panel (ILLEGAL_STATE).

setComponentListener

public void setComponentListener(ComponentListener listener)
This registers the component listener. Only one listener can be registered to the panel. When the setComponentListener method is called several times, only the last registered listener is valid. When null is designated as a listener object, the registration of the listener will be cancelled.

Parameters:
listener - Designates the listener object to be registered.

setSoftKeyListener

public void setSoftKeyListener(SoftKeyListener listener)
This registers the soft key listener. Only one listener can be registered to the panel. When the setSoftKeyListener method is called several times, only the last registered listener is valid. When null is designated as a listener object, the registration of the listener will be cancelled.

Parameters:
listener - Designates the listener object to be registered.

setKeyListener

public void setKeyListener(KeyListener listener)
This registers the key listener. Only one listener can be registered to the panel. When the setKeyListener method is called several times, only the last registered listener is valid. When null is designated as a listener object, the registration of listener will be cancelled.

Parameters:
listener - Designates the listener object to be registered.

setFocusManager

public void setFocusManager(FocusManager fm)
This sets the focus management object that controls movement of the focus among components on the panel. In default, a focus management object that is implementation defined is set.

Parameters:
fm - Designates the focus management object.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is set for the argument fm.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when a layout manager other than those provided by the system is designated for argument fm.

getFocusManager

public FocusManager getFocusManager()
This obtains the focus management object that controls movement of the focus among components on the panel.

Returns:
The focus management object.

setLayoutManager

public void setLayoutManager(LayoutManager lm)
This sets the layout management object that controls the arrangement of components on the panel.
In default, layout management objects that are implementation defined are set. When null is set for a parameter, the panel does not manage the layout. In such cases, the application programmer must appropriately set the coordinates for all components.

Parameters:
lm - Designates the layout management object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when layout manages other than those provided by the system are designated for the argument lm.
